page.title: 04Farms North of Llanfihangel
page.content: The farms are small varying from 25-100 acres & have been in the family for many years. Small farmers rent land to increase their acreage while others keep their small & and also have other jobs. Some farmhouses are lived in by people other than farmers who could live up to 40 miles away. Very often the occupiers act as caretakers. Farms are mainly sheep and store cattle and milking herds, depending on their on their positions. There is a minority interest in horses. Hay, silage, barley & Swedes are grown for animal fodders. Nearly every farmer turns part of a field over to potatoes & vegetables & hens for family use. Help is always available from neighbours (farmers & others) when hay making & sheep shearing & dipping are to be done.
